name: Mesozoic Masterpieces
tagline: Bring the Jurassic world to life through creative multimedia at our Mesozoic showcase.
description: Step back into the age of dinosaurs with our Mesozoic-themed creative showcase. From thundering T-rexes to soaring Pterodactyls, bring the Jurassic world to life through photography, sound, and animation.

rules.text: Submissions must not use copyrighted material without explicit rights or licenses.
Kreacon may use and publish submissions on their websites/newsletters with appropriate attribution and links.
The 'General Rules' apply to all competition categories.
Photos must be taken at recognized museums or dig sites
Maximum file size 20MB per photograph
The 'General Rules' apply to all competition categories.

name: Debug Derby
tagline: Where breaking things is part of the fun!
description: Join our quirky beta testing event where finding bugs is celebrated and edge cases are embraced. Submit your most creative ways of stress-testing applications, or just help us find interesting ways to make things go wrong!

name: Fossil Finds
tagline: Share your best fossil photography and help bring these ancient remnants to life.
description: A special exhibition focusing on recent paleontological discoveries. Share your best fossil photography and help bring these ancient remnants to life.

rules.text: Submissions must not use copyrighted material without explicit rights or licenses.

name: Beacon 2026
tagline: A LAN party for gamers, by gamers.
description: Join us for an exciting showcase of digital creativity where artists, programmers, and musicians come together to push the boundaries of real-time computer art. From stunning visual demos to creative coding experiments, Kreacon celebrates the intersection of technology and artistic expression. Whether you're a seasoned demo scene veteran or a curious newcomer, we welcome all creative minds to participate, learn, and share their work with our community.

rules.text: Submissions should be delivered in a format as close as possible to 1920x1080 resolution. Other formats will be rescaled as needed.
Submissions must not use copyrighted material without explicit rights or licenses.
The Submission mustn't have been shown/played at any similar event/demoparty/creative workshop before this event.
The submission shouldn't have been publicly spread and known before the party.
Keep it family friendly, and not offensive.
We reserve the right to reject any submission if we feel they don't comply with all of the rules.
Proof should be provided in a .zip file, where requested.
Maximum play time is 10 minutes.
Beacon may use the submission in marketing etc.
Maximum file size is 1GB. We recommend using https://handbrake.fr/ to compress your submission.
Not all submissions make it to the stage. There will be a preselection process.
All General Rules apply.
The submission must be an interactive real-time application.
Maximum play time is 5 minutes for a typical session.
The entry must run on the official party hardware without installation or configuration.
Keyboard and or gamepad input only.
The entry must not crash, freeze, or require a restart during normal use (unless it's a feature).
Include a short readme describing interaction, controls, and any special requirements.
All General Rules apply.
Maximum runtime: 7 minutes.
Uncompressed file size: 64MB max, including extras like readmes. Use any compression algorithm for packed parts.
No raw animationsâ€”that's for Wild.
Third-party assets? Make sure you've got the licenses and give proper credit.
All General Rules apply.
Tag your files! Include artist and entry names in the metadata (e.g., ID3 tags).
Max playtime: 4 minutes.
Proof of production is mandatory. This can include project files, screenshots, or other materials that demonstrate the creation process.
Your mod must fit on a floppy (1.44 MB max).
Keep it under 4 minutes.
Maximum 32 channels.
The submission must include a rendered version (MP3/WAV).
The submission must include the original module file.
Must be made in a proper tracker format (check out: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Module_file)
All General Rules apply.
Submit at least two in-progress files or photos to show your creative journey.
All General Rules apply.
Provide at least two in-progress files or images.
No animations allowed.
Max resolution: 320x200, 8-bit indexed color depth (255 colors).
All General Rules apply.
Please do light edits like color correction and sharpening.
Heavy photo manipulation is not allowed.
HDR is allowed.
Drastic composition changes are not allowed.
All General Rules apply.
The submission must be a stop motion video.
All General Rules apply.
All General Rules apply.
Entries will be judged like regular photography, focusing on composition, lighting, and overall quality.
